title: Biden Administration Seeks to Limit Drilling Around Chaco Canyon, a Sacred Native American Area
sub_head: Interior Department to consider 20-year ban on new oil and gas leasing near New Mexico cultural site
body:
WASHINGTON—The Biden administration is taking steps to block oil and gas leasing within a 10-mile radius around New Mexico’s Chaco Canyon, a site considered sacred to Native Americans.
The White House said on Monday that the Interior Department in the coming weeks will begin considering a 20-year withdrawal of federal lands within 10 miles of Chaco Culture National Historical Park. Such a move would prevent oil and gas leasing and development in the area, the White House said.
